column4: Where is the startup-script located so i can load modules at startup? i want to run "modprobe quickcam" at startup to load my webcam, but i dont know where to find the script, or the syntax of the script.. can anyone please help me?
create a text file in /etc/modprobe.d/
say u want to load the "modulex', create a text file "module x" in /etc/modprobe.d/
ok :) but should anything be written in the file?
either that /etc/modules ...add ur module to the end
now ive made a file in /etc/modprobe.d/ and its empty, or should it contain any text? i see the other files there have some text inside...
my bad...if you want to alias that module to something, you would add the text "alias modulex more_friendly_name_for_modulex" in the file
to just load the module, just add it to /etc/modules
Ok :) should i delete the file in /etc/modprobe.d/ ?
yeah
thanks alot for the help =)
hope that works :)

another question: i have quickcam messenger (yes, the one that should not work in linux at all) andnow ive got the picture working now, i can see myself live trough xawtv :) but ive read that "The standard usb mic driver in the kernel works for the built in microphone as well.".. Where can i find this driver and enable it? if its not loaded already.. can you help me with that to maybe?
cool...i need to look for that driver too, never bothered to check my mic on the laptop..uno momento!
thanks again! :) your a great help for n00bs like me! :)
is that a laptop u are using, and which one?
no, i have a stationary PC, and the mic is built-in to the quickcam messenger webcam
sorry..have no idea abt that
ok, but what was the command for installing .deb-files again? :P i just keep asking an asking :p
dpkg -i
Thanks =) Have a nice night (if its night where you are too) =)
